intro: Raphionacme angolensis, commonly known as the Angola raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Raphionacme angolensis is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
